Reason: The 'threadCount' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the concurrency and parallelism of the system. Changing the value of 'threadCount' can significantly affect the system's execution time and resource utilization, especially in multi-threaded applications like 'dconverter'. A higher 'threadCount' may lead to better performance by utilizing more CPU cores efficiently, while a lower 'threadCount' may result in slower processing due to limited parallelism.
